result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica S Turley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Counseling per the agents recommendations.  Comply with the CHIPS order/case.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  6 month review with Court.  Bond on hand will be applied towards costs.

filed by defendant, requesting early discharge from probation.
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch
filed by atty Dolch

Defendant Monica S Turley in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to cts. 1 & 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 3 dismissed but read in.  On cts. 1 & 2 court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: Counseling per the agents recommendations, comply with the CHIPS case/order.  AODA and comply.  Ct. 1 $443.00 costs, Ct. 2 $243.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  6 month review.  13 days credit.  Bond on hand to be applied towards costs.

9:05 A.M., Defendant Monica S Turley in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting bond contitiond be modified, State agrees children may be returned home, Lutheran Social Services to provide supervision from Monday through Friday from 3 P.M. to 9 P.M.,  T.D. to not reside in the home, Court approves, 9:09 A.M.
